discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
SoS Utility Options for Managing ESXi Hosts --disable-lockdown-esxi 

Deactivate lockdown mode on ESXi nodes in the specified domains.

To deactivate lockdown on ESXi nodes in a specific domain, include the flag --domain-name DOMAINNAME.
To deactivate lockdown on ESXi nodes in all domains, include the flag --domain-name ALL.
Note:
If you do not specify domain, this command affects only the MGMT domain by default.

Selected Answer: D
With SOS tool you can enenable/disable lockdown mode on ESXi hosts

REF: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-Foundation/4.5/vcf-admin/GUID-9EBC6D42-B799-4177-9EFF-78E98FDBA0FD.html

Correct choice is D

choices.A: It is used to renew VCF licenses upon expiration.
choices.D: It is used to enable/disable lockdown mode on ESXi hosts.
choices.B: It is used to upload upgrade bundles to SDDC Manager when internet access to SDDC Manager is forbidden.
choices.C: It is used to stretch VCF domains to multiple availability zones.

questions.question_text: Which statement is correct about Supportability and Serviceability (SOS) utility on VMware Cloud Foundation (VCF)?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
checking in my lab, while createing a network pool, vMotion is enabled by defautl , the option can not be unchecked, so the rest of the options are vSAN, NFS and iSCSI

Selected Answer: E
for network pool creation vSAN, NFS, iSCSI and vMotion are the wizard options, since for a new WLD creation vMotion is a must, depending of the required storage vSAN or iSCSI are valind answers, C,E or D,E

Selected Answer: DE
The question does not mention about storage is in used.
If the WD use vSAN storage the answer should be D and E.
IF the WD use iSCSI storage then the answer should be C and E.

In my opion, i would make a decesion with D and E.

questions.question_text: Which statement is true about vSphere with Tanzu namespaces?

choices.A: All namespace permissions require at least a vSphere Power User role along with permission to the namespace.
choices.D: Users can have permission to a namespace without requiring vSphere permissions.
choices.B: Permissions assigned to a namespace grant permissions to vSphere.
choices.C: Only administrator@vsphere.local can assign permissions to namespaces.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
based on course lab and materials

Selected Answer: A
If the VMware Cloud Builder VM uses the eth0 interface (default), you do not need to modify any of the network properties in Section I of the via.properties file. If the VMware Cloud Builder VM has multiple network interfaces and is not using eth0, you must update certain network properties.
Property "via.network.interface" is used to specify the interface of the VMware Cloud Builder VM that is configured in the management network

comments.content: why do you think this answer?

Official course material mentions:
If the VMware Cloud Builder VM uses the eth0 interface (default), you do not need to modify any of the network properties in Section I of the via.properties file. If the VMware Cloud Builder VM has multiple network interfaces and is not using eth0, you must update certain network properties.

choices.A: Update the via.properties on the VMware Imaging Appliance
choices.C: Configure a dedicated DHCP server on the untagged imaging network
choices.D: Move all the servers to a VLAN-backed network
choices.B: Ensure the networks connected to eth0 and eth1 are routable

questions.question_text:
An administrator is preparing to image several hosts using the VMware Imaging Appliance. The appliance has been modified with an additional virtual network interface (eth1), which is connected to the same untagged L2 network as the servers which will be imaged.
The original interface (eth0) is connected to a routable network, which is reachable from the administrator's desktop.
Which action must the administrator take to allow for successful host imaging?
